info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 12 at 8:24PM MST until February 14 at 11:00PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM MONDAY TO 11 PM MST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 1 and 4 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Canyon Ferry Area, Beaverhead and Western Madison below 6000ft, Missouri Headwaters and Ruby Mountains and Southern Beaverhead Mountains. * WHEN...From 5 PM Monday to 11 PM MST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A Pacific cold front will bring periods of accumulating snow Monday night into Tuesday morning. Then a stronger cold front moves north to south Tuesday afternoon and evening, bringing another round of accumulating snow, along with gusty northerly winds.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website. To see a graphical representation of the degree of stress on young livestock please visit our webpage and select Local Programs then Cold Air Advisory for Newborn Livestock.
